intro: Brachistus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy brachistus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, giving the plant its common name. Brachistus pubescens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
